roleset.name: have a monopoly on, having a monopoly (watch out for non-events!)

example.name: corner-v: corner the market
example.text: Since then , Intel has cornered a large part of the market with successive generations of 16 - bit and 32 - bit chips , all of which can run software written for previous models .

propbank.arg: a large part of the market
with successive generations of 16 - bit and 32 - bit chips , all of which can run software written for previous models

example.name: corner-v: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: President Hosni Mubarak 's ruling party now controls at least 127 of the 444 parliamentary seats , the Muslim Brotherhood has won six , legal opposition parties control four and other independent candidates have cornered 29 , but these numbers are subject to change as some independent winners pledged their loyalty to President Mubarak 's party .

roleset.note: CORNER-V NOTES: That was a surprisingly clunky example. (from corner.01-v)
CORNER-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on WN eventive noun lexicon, corner.01. No VNcls. (from corner.01-n)
ANNOTATION NOTE: If it's a spatial feature, it's NOT an event! Call it .YY! (from corner.01-n)
